text: Claiborne de Borda Pell (November 22, 1918 â€“ January 1, 2009) was an American politician and writer. He was a United States Senator from Rhode Island for six terms from 1961 to 1997. He was a member of the Democratic Party. Pell is the longest serving U.S. Senator from Rhode Island. He retired from the U.S. Senate because of bad health since he had Parkinson's disease.Associated Press, Sen.
